alert.note: Alert for Morris; Sussex; Warren (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 04 at 4:26PM EDT until July 04 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southwestern Morris County in northern New Jersey... Southern Sussex County in northwestern New Jersey... East central Warren County in northwestern New Jersey... * Until 500 PM EDT. * At 426 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Budd Lake, or 11 miles south of Newton, moving south at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. * Locations impacted include... Hopatcong, Hackettstown, Mount Arlington, Mendham, Stanhope, Netcong, Chester, Allamuchy-Panther Valley, Succasunna, Succasunna-Kenvil, Long Valley, Budd Lake and Beatyestown. This includes Interstate 80 in New Jersey between mile markers 20 and 30. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
